memes.title: Nanoseconds
memes.alt: Grace hopper on chat show Letterman (late night TV old footage) holds a peice of wire that demonstrates the maximum distance an electron can travel in a nanosecond.

memes.title: This lifestyle is inhumane
memes.alt: Pictures of the evolution of a human man, in a historical painted style, from hunched ape to standing naked hunter, back to man hunched over a computer naked.
memes.caption: ‚Äüthis style of knowledge work, this lifestyle, is inhumane‚Äù - Bret Victor (ex-Apple inventor)

footnotes.text: ‚ÄüSomething, somewhere went terribly wrong‚Äù image by an unknown artist (Localoaf, 2011) cited researchgate.net 2021
Full 1 hour talk video: The Humane Representation of Thought by Bret Victor
(He's an ex-Apple Human-Interface inventor in the Future-Interface Team)

memes.title: Squeezed Apple
memes.alt: Tim Cook being asked an uncomfortable question in a political house hearing about why developers can only sell apps throug the app store. Tim Looks like he's squeezing out a tough turd.
memes.caption: Tim Cook squeezes one out

memes.title: The world is actually getting better
memes.alt: Animated graph showing the world is actually getting richer and healthier since presented by Hans Rosling.
memes.caption: Shame bad news sells

alsoSee.text: Bill Gate's Favourite book of all time is Steven Pinker's 'Enlightenment Now'. There's a reason why. [3 min video]

memes.title: How I feel when filling out questionnaires
memes.alt: Tom Hanks in Saving Private Ryan - storming the beach in during D-Day spinning out in the chaos and stress.

footnotes.text: Video: Tom Hanks in Saving Private Ryan (1998) storming the beach during D-Day (Normandy in the second World War retaking France from the Nazis.) He's trying to anyway.

memes.title: Banter is classless
memes.alt: An upper class woman from Chelsea has a date with a working class man from London. They both enjoy each other's 'banter'.
memes.caption: This sums up everything that is right and wrong about 'banter'

memes.title: How many computer geeks does it take to change a light bulb?
memes.alt: Light bulb. Title reads: How many computer geeks does it take to change a light bulb? One, but I take days connecting it to the internet to save time flicking the switch. louiechristie.com ¬© 2020
memes.caption: ... one, but I take days connecting it to the internet to save time flicking the switch üí°

memes.title: Bill Hicks on traditional families leaves producer speechless
memes.alt: Bill Hicks in a pub, old film footage

memes.title: How the Finnish are world happiest
memes.alt: Woman in hat and winter clothes (looks like skiing type clothes) sits at a table in the snow, she looks unhappy.
memes.caption: "When you walk on the streets in Finland, people don't seem to be particularly happy, and I would actually think that might contribute positively to our sense of satisfaction... if you live among people where everyone's kind of like advertising their own happiness, like telling 'hey, look at me how happy I am' that might actually make you like more sad." - Frank Martela PhD Psychology, Aalto University

memes.title: If you feel that face masks don't protect you...
memes.alt: World map with red dots all over it. USA is particularly covered in red dots. Title over the map in big letters reads 'THIS WEEK IN VIROLOGY #673 WAKE UP AND SMELL THE PANDEMIC'
memes.caption: ‚Äò... then the next time you have surgery tell your surgical team not to wear face masks‚Äô - Vincent Racaniello, Professor of Immunology at Columbia University

footnotes.text: As I was making this (during the 2020 pandemic) some fucking muppets interrupted selling door-to-door, one with a mask that didn't cover her nose. üò°
